greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways of writing n as the sum of three odd squares.
comment: Number of ways of writing n as the sum of the squares of three odd numbers (see example). Equals 8*A008437 because each summand can be the square of either a positive or negative odd number, and there are three summands, thus 2^3 = 8. - _Antti Karttunen_ & _Michel Marcus_, Jul 23 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
J. E. Jones [Lennard-Jones] and A. E. Ingham, On the calculation of certain crystal potential constants and on the cubic crystal of least energy, Proc. Royal Soc., A 107 (1925), 636-653 (see p. 650).
xref: Cf. A005875, A008437. The nonzero coefficients give A005878.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 25 2004
